0.text: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one.
0.author: George R.R. Martin

1.text: You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me.
1.author: C.S. Lewis

2.text: You believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself.
2.author: Marilyn Monroe

3.text: If you can make a woman laugh, you can make her do anything.
3.author: Marilyn Monroe

4.text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
4.author: Albert Einstein

5.text: The real lover is the man who can thrill you by kissing your forehead or smiling into your eyes or just staring into space.
5.author: Marilyn Monroe

6.text: A wise girl kisses but doesn't love, listens but doesn't believe, and leaves before she is left.
6.author: Marilyn Monroe

7.text: Only in the darkness can you see the stars.
7.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

8.text: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
8.author: J.K. Rowling

9.text: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
9.author: James Baldwin
